text:
Use the following data to answer Questions 15 through 18.
Two samples were drawn from two normally distributed populations. For the first sample,
the mean was $50 and the standard deviation was $5. For the second sample, the mean was
$55 and the standard deviation was $6. The first sample consists of 25 observations and the
second sample consists of 36 observations. (Note: In the questions below, the subscripts “1”
and “2” indicate the first and second sample, respectively.)
